intro: Linociera latipetala, commonly known as the broad-petaled linociera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Linociera latipetala is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
